name: enthusiasm

B2 [ U ] a feeling of energetic interest in a particular subject or activity and an eagerness to be involved in it: One of the good things about teaching young children is their enthusiasm.enthusiasm for After the accident he lost his enthusiasm for the sport.work up enthusiasm I just can't work up (= start to feel) any enthusiasm for the whole project.
[ C ] a subject or activity that interests you very much: One of his greatest enthusiasms was yoga.
More examplesFewer examplesHis enthusiasm more than compensates for his lack of experience.Nothing you can say will dampen her enthusiasm.She thanked the staff for their dedication and enthusiasm.She has boundless energy and enthusiasm.It's strange, but I can't work up any enthusiasm for going on this trip.
